column4: hey guys how do I install python-software-properties in 11.04?
sudo apt-get install python-software-properties; is there some error?
can you guide me through it, I just download that and do dpkg on it?
the reason I wanted policy was not for the version, but for the repos from which the packages come from
I see, you are on lucid, but are just using the python version from natty, that is probably not the greatest idea
I believe I'm on Natty Narwal
pastebin /etc/apt/sources.list, because policy has lucid repos
but yeah I can tell its all using Lucid!

not sure why the system indicates natty, that isn't a stock sources.list though, anyway, easiest fix is probably to revert to the lucid python: sudo apt-get install python=2.6.5-0ubuntu1; then python-software-properties should install
unless of course there are deeper problems
were there any issues installing the older python version? did it try to change any other packages?

did you get everything working with python-software-properties? after rethinking it, I agree with wols_, even though you have the lucid repos, the command I gave is probably a very bad idea without further investigation
probably the safest bet, although you should probably ask whoever set up the VPS why you have natty packages but lucid repos
do you think I should wait till he responds to me lol
